content: ann s scarf hat gressmanoriginals size small medium large to fit head circumference 18-20 20-22 22-24 46-51 51-56 56-61 cm height 7 8 9 /18 20 23 cm materials alpacas d auxvasse suri merino dk 85% suri 15% merino 500 yd 457 m /200 g 7 oz 1 skein size 6 4 0 mm 16 /40 cm circular size 6 4 0 mm dpn s for crown shaping 8 stitch markers including one that is recognizable as the beginning of round marker waste yarn or stitch holder tapestry needle gauge 20 st and 25 rnds = 4 /10 cm in stockinette stitch worked in the round abbreviations eor = end of round when knitting the hat section end of row when working scarf section k1tbl = knit 1 stitch through the back loop k2tog = knit 2 stitches together one stitch decreased kfb = knit into the front and the back of the stitch one stitch increased m = marker pm = place marker rm = remove marker rs = right side of work sl 1 = slip 1 stitch as if to purl sm = slip marker yo = yarn over needle one stitch increased to work the yo on the edge stitch pattern just keep the yarn in front and when you knit the next stitch it will automatically create a yo that will be decreased on the next row ws = wrong side of work wyif = with yarn held to the front of work x _ _ _ = work instructions inside the number of times indicated after the x for your size link to pin hole cast one https //www youtube com/watch v=8hasa_c2k-4 © 2024 susan gressman for personal use only all rights reserved page 1 designer notes this hat begins with an 8 stitch pinhole cast on and uses yo s worked through the back loop to create crown increases the main body of the hat uses a simple garter/ k2p2 rib pattern to create a reversible pattern than will be worked throughout to create the attached scarf sections crown using the pin hole method provided in the link or your favorite method cast on 8 stitches distribute them evenly over the 4 dpn s and pm for beginning of the round round 1 k round 2 *k1 yo pm repeat from * to eor 16 sts round 3 *k to 1 st before m k1tbl repeat from * to eor round 4 *k to m yo repeat from * to eor 8 stitches increased repeat rnds 3 and 4 until you have a total of 96 104 112 stitches 12 13 14 stitches between markers begin body you may remove all except the beginning of round marker at this time round 1 k to eor round 2 p to eor round 3 k to eor round 4 p to eor round 5 *k2 p2 repeat from * to eor round 6 *k2 p2 repeat from * to eor round 7 *k2 p2 repeat
